intro: Clidemia campii, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas, often in the understory of tropical forests. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth surface and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Clidemia campii is also known for its ability to thrive in humid environments and is often found in coastal and lowland regions.
